quote: In the moment when I truly understand my enemy, understand him well enough to defeat him, then in that very moment I also love him. I think its impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves. And then, in that very moment when I love them... I destroy them.
Keep in mind that many people have died for their beliefs; its actually quite common. The real courage is in living and suffering for what you believe.
I stop aiming straight, since thatâ€™s not working. If it always curves to the left, I aim to the right.

Words are what we make them. Without the words surrounding them, without brains to interpret them, words are but whispers in the wind. It's a word's utlility to the speaker and the reaction of the listener that causes words to be born, and to live, and to die.
In life, there are no solutions, only trade-offs.
Humans are shockingly complicated dice that are really good at convincing themselves they are picking the numbers they are rolling.
This is how humans are: We question all our beliefs, except for the ones that we really believe in, and those we never think to question.
With the right tools, forever isn't as long as it used to be.
Darkness cannot drive out darkness, only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate, only love can do that.
